p: About three-quarters of laboratory-confirmed HEV infected patients were males. One explanation for this may be that males are more involved in outdoor activities than females in low- and middle-income countries [ 44], putting them at higher risk for exposure to contaminated drinking water. Other reasons for this observation could be due to gender differences in health-seeking behaviour and access to health services. A recent study noted that healthcare expenditure on females is significantly lower than on males in low-income settings [ 45].
